utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God!

utterances.speaker: GREG GUTFELD, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: I'm Greg Gutfeld with Kimberly Guilfoyle, Juan Williams, Jesse Watters, and she flies first class on a paper airplane, Dana Perino -- "The Five."

utterances.speaker: Yesterday, Nancy Pelosi, a true champion of women, defended John Conyers over claims of sexual harassment. She was awful
REP. NANCY PELOSI, D-CALIF.
utterances.utterance: John Conyers is an icon in our country. He's done a great deal to protect women. The Violence Against Women Act, which the right wing is now quoting me as praising him on his work on that. He did great work on that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Ah yes, the "icon clause" -- in which public service excuses private behavior. I call it the pig pass: The more progressive you are the more disgusting you could be. Champion publicly, harass privately, or if you're Ted Kennedy, Harvey Weinstein or Bill Clinton, not so privately. Apparently, Conyers would show up to a meeting in his underwear. Strange, but maybe it was casual Friday. But while Nancy wants due process for Conyers, she's not behind it for private citizens. She supported Title IX which allows schools, not the law, to handle rape cases. We've never expect a college to settle a murder rap -- it makes no sense.

utterances.speaker: Anyway, it's not like defending bad behavior is new for Nancy
TIM RUSSERT, NBC NEWS

utterances.speaker: PELOSI
utterances.utterance: Well, I like to say that I think that the women of America are speaking out about what they think about this whole situation. And the women of America are just like other Americans and that they value fairness, they value privacy, and do not want to see a person with uncontrolled power, uncontrolled time, uncontrolled -- unlimited money investigating the president of the United States.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'll say this, at least she's consistent in her hypocrisy for whom she defends is always based on politics. If the harasser is on your team, you soften your stance. It happens on the left, and now it is on the right. But the left made it an art form. No wonder Alabamans ignore media about Roy Moore. But the real scandal, let's call that "Congregate." That's where your money is being used to settle cases involving politicians' misconduct. "Congregate." How is this OK? And how did the media miss "Congregate," 234 incidences in Congress covered up by $17 million in taxpayer money could be one of the biggest stories in decades, and it flew right under our radar, but not anymore. No wonder Nancy looks so nervous or excited. I mean, I can never tell. Oh, geez, where to start, so much here. Is this a big deal, "Congregate"?

utterances.speaker: DANA PERINO, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: I like "Congregate." I think that everyone should hashtag right now and give you full credit.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I know. Even thought, maybe, I might have stolen it from a celebrity friend of mine.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: When I saw the Nancy Pelosi interview on "Meet the Press," I thought it was communications malpractice because when your boss is going to go on a Sunday show, you get together and you prep.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: . and you think about what are all the possible questions that are going to be -- that we're going to get. This is obviously going to be one of them. So I have to ask, was this planned?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: When she is practicing the answer, does it not occur to anybody that this sounds really bad?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah. Kimberly, how do you think she did there? I mean, she's done it before. At least she's consistent.

utterances.speaker: KIMBERLY GUILFOYLE, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: Yeah. Maybe the older clip was more compelling. But, you know, it's a double standard hypocrisy. Why did she even go out and say that? If they can make excuses and say, oh, their champion of women's rights before. The iconic figure. That doesn't give you a pass for inappropriate behavior, or sexual assault, or misconduct or sexual harassment. So You see people making excuses saying, well, he's older. He didn't know what he was really doing, or it's not that sexy because he's older. I mean, that also makes no sense.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Jesse, it's a problem, especially showing up for work in your underwear.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I don't know anything about that, so maybe somebody else here at the table do, Gutfeld. I think the Democrats have lost their moral authority on sexual harassment, not that they every had any to begin with. I think that Pelosi played herself because she put power over principle. She's either too afraid of the congressional black caucus, or she knows there are a ton of shoes that are about to drop on some of the other members of the Democratic Party, so she doesn't want zero-tolerance because she's trying to retake back the house. The icon excuse.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Maybe both.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Probably. The icon excuse, I think she's using icon a little too loosely there. The guy is a congressman. He's not Muhammad Ali. And there are actual icon recently that have been taken down by sexual harassment that are a lot more iconic than John Conyers, and that excuse did not work for them either.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We won't mention their names.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: She's also using the Harvey Weinstein and Bill Clinton excuse.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

It's not like he's the victim here.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Exactly.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He handled the -- that's how he decided to do the due process.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That was the due process.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I like it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's a big deal. I mean, should they make all of this transparent and let everybody know what these cases were? Is it going to be a nightmare?

utterances.speaker: JUAN WILLIAMS, CO-HOST
utterances.utterance: I think that would be a nightmare. I think there is some need for confidentiality. But I just think -- I listening to you and I'm just like, wow. So this is how you're handling Roy Moore? You're going to accuse the Democrats of hypocrisy. When I heard Nancy Pelosi yesterday, I think Dana is not right, she didn't look great, but here's what she said. No matter about the legacy. There is no license for bad behavior in terms of sexual harassment and zero-tolerance. That's from Nancy Pelosi. I don't hear that from you guys. Instead, you're busy trying to make the case that Nancy Pelosi is making an excuse for him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She did.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: She didn't. I'll weaken my own argument. The worse that she said was I don't know who these women are, when in fact part of the deal was that the women would not be public with their allegations.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah. I mean, you did weaken your argument strongly.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Because I want everything on the table. But I must say that she did not say what you say she says zero-tolerance. And by the way, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What does zero-tolerance mean, Juan?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Jesse, let me just tell you something. That guy is an icon. John Conyers, not only in terms of what he did as a member of congress on title IX, other issues that she was talking about.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: What exactly?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: . but establishing the congressional black caucus.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'm not putting John Conyers down. I'm just saying if you go out on the street and ask anybody who John Conyers is, no one knows who he is. That is not iconic.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I'm sorry. Maybe it's your age, but John Conyers is pretty well-known in Washington and in Michigan. I don't think there's any question.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Just because people know him in Washington, doesn't mean the rest of the country knows him.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I agree. You know what, more people wouldn't know who Nancy Pelosi is if you ask -- here's a picture, who's this?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I consider myself an icon. As you are my icon as well. Can we roll this? So Al Franken spoke today against this wonderful black background. It was like he was floating in space. Anyway, let's take a look.

utterances.speaker: SEN. AL FRANKEN, D-MINN.
utterances.utterance: If you had asked me two weeks ago, would any woman come forward with an allegation like this, I would have said no. And so, I cannot speculate. This has been a shock and it's been extremely humbling. I am embarrassed. I feel ashamed. What I'm going to do is I'm going to start my job. I'm going to go back to work.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, as much as I want to make fun of him and stuff, I have to say I saw somebody that is overwhelmed by circumstance. What he said, if you had asked me two weeks that this would happen, I never would have seen this coming, which means he saw this blanket of offensive behavior, grabbing people, as part of a stick. And he's like completely overwhelm. I kind of sense contrition.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm good with something, bad with others. We'll be right back.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So I've talked to a couple staffers that are watching, and they said they were young women and they said they found it to be totally insincere. Now, I think that for him, he probably wasn't mustering up as much sincerity as he could because he never thought this was a problem.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So like, two weeks ago, he never would have thought that he would be in the same category as Harvey Weinstein, or Roy Moore, or whoever else it might be. But different for me, especially watching him is that he says I'm sorry, I'm embarrassed, and I'm ashamed and I'm going back to work. The difference with the private sector is that if you say I'm sorry, I'm ashamed, and they're like, OK, you're still fired.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And then you go.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's what the difference is. Now the Democrats have set something up where if you're Conyers' and you say I deny it, they believe you. Or if you're this guy in Minnesota you say I apologize then you're forgiven. So the Democrats can have it either way, both ways, and they're still absolve.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Jesse, this is news to me. I believe that Conyers is now subject to an ethics investigation.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, no. I bet Conyers is shaking in his shoes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: He's denied the allegations. This is like you guys are trying to set Democrats up as strongmen who -- whenever it's a Democrat they excuse sexual harassment.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan, I'm just holding you guys to the same standards that you guys set. You said zero-tolerance.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Zero tolerance.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You said you believe every single woman that comes forward. And now, they've settled multiple harassment lawsuits. There's photographic evidence, and now all of a sudden, oh, ethics investigation.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Jesse, stop. Hold on. But Jesse, if you look at Harvey Weinstein, Kevin Spacey, Bill Cosby, I can go on, I don't see Democrats defending these folks. I see Democrats saying there's a problem here. And yet, when you come to Roy Moore.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And all those guys.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Roy Moore, oh, no problem, Roy Moore.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Let me draw a distinction here with Kimberly. I see it differently than Juan between the Republicans and the Democrats. Roy Moore is actually running against Mitch McConnell, and Franken and Conyers are actually backed by their party. So it's the Republicans who are actually being noble about this, right? They want Moore to step aside. But the Democrats.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Is that what President Trump said?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: The governor.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: There is no lockstep in the Republican Party. As you can tell here they're lock step in boxers.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But not with younger women in the Democratic Party. They don't like it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: They're mad at Nancy. Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yeah, no, I agree with you. That's why to me it's perplexing because the biggest in was the first problem with Bill Clinton where you saw Democrats and they're still not even really that willing to call him out on his behavior despite those women being brave, coming forward, telling their stories repeatedly, making fresh complaints at the time, physical evidence, etcetera, of injury like with Juanita Broderick. And now you see the Democrat -- oh, wait a second. Conyers is iconic. So therefore get your fruit of the loom on. Sit in your underwear. It's all good. Geraldo tried this with me the other night. He said.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Oh, my goodness.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Wait a minute, I mean on the air, on Hannity. And he said, well, Conyers, come on, he's the older guy, he's not that sexy sitting there. I said, but that's not the standard you say it's Beckham or not. That is not the point. That is not the point. He said, well, it's an old guy, I don't think it was meant to be that way. I was like, yeah, I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: If you use that excuse it has do to with mental faculties, saying like he wasn't aware that his robe was open.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, that was something the New York Times has reported, and they said that he actually showed up in his robe on a number of occasions at public events.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So maybe it's something that isn't -- maybe it's more sad than it is.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: He's 88.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But this has been going on for years. He's been in congress for 50 years.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: He's the longest serving member right now. He's an older person.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's about this issue on the NDA's, whether they should all be reveal and we should have total transparency. Sometimes NDA's are there to protect the victim. And I don't that we should be out calling for all of them to name public, writ large, and just say rip the banner up because it's tax payer dollars and we want to know. I think victims deserve a say on whether.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I mean, honestly, to honor the law and the contract and protect both sides.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But do you think that NDA's prolong the problem by silencing it?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Maybe.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Maybe there's part of it that will come out earlier.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No. We know that. That is actually true. That doesn't mean that there couldn't be a victim who would say I don't want my name out there.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Maybe they don't want that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: . because they fine.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I think more than anybody they don't want it out there. It's not comfortable to come forward or make a claim.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But then you have serial abusers who continue because of these NDA's. You know, you can have 5 or 6 NDA's under one guy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes, we know that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And they didn't want to sign the NDA's either. They were force into it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: These are important questions that we will continue covering for the next 15 years. Trump's person of the year tweet got a lot of pushback, but was he right? Did he pulled back the curb Times effort to land him, next.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: President Trump's Time Magazine feud and his Pocahontas correct, two controversies getting a lot of attention today. First stop, Time Magazine. Next week the publication will announce its pick for person of the year. The president creating a frenzy over the holiday weekend with one of his tweets. This one claiming he pulled himself out of contention for the title saying, Time Magazine called to say that I was probably going to be name man, person, of the year like last year, but I would have to agree to an interview and a major photo shoot. I said probably is no good and took a pass, thanks anyway. The publication disputed it, dangle and offered to him, writing that the president is incorrect about how we choose person of the year. Time does not comment on our choice until publication which is December 6. And I might show that they have -- Time Magazine does a poll, an online poll, which is not scientific poll, and they ask people who should be Time person of the year. Right now, at 4:00 today, Mohammed Bin Salman, the crown prince of Saudi Arabia, he's going to be the king there, at 16 percent. And then you see all sorts of other people. The dreamers, Kaepernick.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I was going to say that you see Kaepernick -- Kaepernick is like number five.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Number five.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Guess where Donald Trump is at that poll?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Oh, no, it's like way down. I know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: We know that that's a garbage poll if you have Mohammed Bin Salman there. It's a garbage -- America doesn't even know who he is.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Is it like bot?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You mean like Saudi bots.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Saudi bots.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: . voting for him over and over again. You were in the magazine (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Time is lying. They wanted Trump, they contacted him. They wanted a fresh suit -- a fresh photo shoot. He said OK. Am I going to be man of the year? They said probably. This is what Maxim used to do for their hot 100. They'd work with publicists to make deals. You want Christina Aguilera, I'm talking about early 2000, you want a cover because of that new photo because that sells copies. So you promise her number one, and you often also offer gifts. Do you think Blake Shelton won sexiest man of the year on People because he was sexy? No.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, no, no. They traded for exclusivity for him and Gwen to talk about the relationship because in gossip world that opium. So what they did -- Trump realized that Time needed him more than he needed Time. It was a negotiation and a deal. Again, you pulled back the curtain. He said this is how magazines work. They were negotiating for a fresh photo shoot because they know he sells copies, and he said I don't really need you, and then everybody gets upset about it. They're upset about it because they can't believe that a guy can operate with such lack of humility, the kind of insecurities that they have. They just sit there and they go like, this is -- how could he do this? Because he can.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Let me ask you something, who do you trust? Do you trust Trump and not the editor if Time Magazine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: . who had bluntly said this is not.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Why would he make that up?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Fifteen years in magazine, I know how you do cover deals.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Right. And I know as a journalist that Donald Trump has a loose relationship with the facts and the truth. He's obsessed with this Time Magazine stuff to the point.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You say this conversation never happened? This conversation, I'll bet you a steak dinner this conversation happened.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, you won the last bet.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Before we get to the other topic, Kimberly, any thoughts on the Time Magazine?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: You know, I believe him. I think it's exactly what happened. I know, like Greg does, where people are trying to get exclusives or do magazine covers. They asked you for this. OK, will you give us a sit down, can we talk about this? Yeah, OK. Then you make a deal with them. I think they got humiliated because he went out and outed them essentially, and went out with it first. So now they're trying to back track and say, no, no, no. That's what happens all the time.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I just remember from when I was at the White House that these calls -- you will get them, but we never actually thought that President Bush was actually going to be given the Time Magazine cover, so we would not -- I don't know how many times he did.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: This is what makes him different. He's like, am I going to be man of the year or not? Tell me.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: But he's right. So just say, OK, are you giving it to me or not?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right, Jesse, on Time Magazine, what do you think?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Sure. I mean, Ari Fleischer, your colleague, when he was press secretary, said in defense of Trump about Time Magazine, in 2001 Time told us Bush might be man of the year. They wanted a photo shoot and an interview. I don't remember if we did it, and they went with Mayor Rudy Giuliani.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: They make several calls.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yeah, they call around. But, I mean, Trump thinks he should be man of the year every year, so whenever he's not man of the year, he believes he was robbed. But that's fine. I mean, Obama got the Nobel Peace Prize on his first year. He's just being competitive.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I don't even think Time Magazine -- but Trump thinks it's being defining.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yeah, it's an old school publication deal.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right. But can we talk about our other subject? This happened earlier today. So the president was giving an event, well, for the Navajo code talkers. There's 13 of them left living, and these are really great Americans. And they got to come to the oval office and have a meeting with the president. So that was the purpose of the event. He also talked about tax reform. And then he had a little bit of this to say.

utterances.speaker: PRESIDENT DONALD TRUMP
utterances.utterance: You were here long before any of us were here. Although, we have a representative in congress who -- they say was here a long time ago. They call her Pocahontas. But you know what? I like you because you are special.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: As soon as I heard it, I thought OK, we're not going to be talking about tax reform.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Why would you.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And then, Sarah Huckabee Sanders when she was asked if it was offensive, she said I think what most people find offensive is Senator Warren lying about her heritage to advance her career. And Senator Warren.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Good come back, by the way.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, what do you think?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think what he was saying is you are real native Americans, and I appreciate real native Americans. Not like this lady over here, Pocahontas. You have to understand while we're watching this, we were all laughing because it's funny. It takes a very little part of your day. Those guys were actually smiling. It was kind of funny.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I think they were older men, and I don't think they didn't understand what was going on. And I think Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Once again, the older defense again.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, no, I don't think those guys were in touch with the kind of current political climate.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He might be right

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Where Trump goes after his political rivals in this event with this kind of racist comments.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Come on, Juan.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Anti-racist. He was saying you're native American. She wasn't. That's anti-racist?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: When you start calling out people and say, oh, she's Pocahontas.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It is because she lied.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's a joke, OK. That is your argument, it's a joke. I think to lots of people, it's not a joke.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: If they can't find it funny, they've got to find their funny bone because you've got four more years of this.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Is that the fact that we've got four more years.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's so interesting because we defend these things by saying, oh, come on, he's funny. And he's like, don't be so thin-skinned. But when the shoe is on the other foot, it's like a different situation. I don't know. Kimberly, your last thought.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I mean, I don't know. So I thought also which was cute, that was getting left behind. He's like (INAUDIBLE).

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: They are true American heroes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: They are.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: We're glad that the Navajo code talkers got their moment in the Oval Office.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: God bless them.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: All right. A fastest setting coming your way. But first, Kimberly breaks out the crown for some very big royal news, next.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Always a nice day for a wedding. Time now for a very special installment of "Kimberly's Royal News." Indeed, yes. Stop the presses, people. Prince Harry is officially off the market. Sorry, ladies. The 33-year-old heartthrob is now engaged to American actress Meghan Markle. The fifth in line to the throne popped the question earlier this month with the blessing of Grandma, of course, the queen.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Boo.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: They will marry sometime this spring. The happy couple appeared before cameras today at Kensington Palace, and then they give an interview to the BBC.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.utterance: Was it an instant yes from you?

utterances.speaker: MEGAN MARKLE, ENGAGED TO PRINCE HARRY
utterances.utterance: Yes, as a matter of fact, I could barely let you finish proposing. I was, like, "Can I say yes now?"

utterances.speaker: PRINCE HARRY, UNITED KINGDOM
utterances.utterance: She wouldn't even let me finish. It was -- then it was hugs, and I had the ring on my finger. And I was like, "Can I give you the ring?" She was, "Oh, yes, the ring." So no, it was a really nice moment. It was just the two of us. And I think I managed to catch her by surprise, as well.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Aww.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Aww. They're very sweet. Even Greg likes it. So what about the ring, right? Royal officials say the prince designed the sparkler for Markle himself. So he is creative, as well. It includes a large center diamond from Botswana where the couple have traveled together. The two smaller outside stones are from his late mother Diana's personal collection. So very sweet to have that special meaning. Something from his mother and also something that's meaningful for them, from a trip that they traveled together to Botswana. Not you. No, Greg, we shall not call on you yet. Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think it's very exciting. I think they're obviously in love, and they have been given some -- I think they've been given some good treatment by the press so far during their dating. And also, I think it's really neat for America and the U.K., because we have a very special relationship going back as political allies, but now I think this is just even more fun for both countries.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I love it. Jesse, do you like it? They're a very sweet couple.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I think they're very sweet. I have so much to say about this. Not really.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Fake it, like you always do.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, it's beautiful. They look like they're in love.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Wow, you're a real romantic.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I love the special relationship that America has with Great Britain. I think this is going to really forge the alliance even stronger now. And they look great together. She's very beautiful. And he fought the Taliban over there in Afghanistan very bravely. So my hat's off to him there.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And the Invictus Games.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And that is all I can come up with right now.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well done. Well done.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And he served his country in the military. Juan, you're into food. So I don't know if you'd like this little tidbit. But the royal couple said they were roasting a chicken on a cozy night at Kensington Palace when this happens.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: They're just like us.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: They're just like us. I mean, can you roast a chicken well?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I was impressed by that, just so you know.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: But do you think they were personally roasting the chicken or having a chicken roasted?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No, I think they were personally roasting it. That's what I think is very sweet.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I'm all for it.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So I thought the most interesting thing that I read about this was that Prince Harry said that he had gone to his brother and just expressed how many years, I think he said it had been 20 years, since his mom, Princess Diana, died when he was 12. That he was emotionally locked up and conflicted, and he wasn't really able to really love or to speak to people or even to do his best work work, and that he went into therapy, and for three years of therapy. It's helped him a lot. And I think he credits that, in part, with being him -- allowing him to be emotionally open to falling in love. And so that's great. And the second thing that interests me as a black American is that he says he thinks the press has been treating his fiancee with racial overtones, because she is half white, half black. And that some of it's just insensitive, he said, and sexism. So I don't think he thinks the press has been very fair to her. She's three years older than he has. I'm surprised they're not picking on that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: They make -- they make a point to say it in every interview.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: She's robbing the cradle? Is that...

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Maybe.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Jesse...

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's what my wife did.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Jackpot.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Greg, just so you know, Juan's comments were really thoughtful and very good analysis.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I didn't know Juan took such a liking to royal news.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Greg, we've left not much time for you. But go ahead.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I think I can speak for most Americans when I can say, "Shoot me in the face." No. 1. Let's get through this quickly, OK? Because I know we only have 30 seconds. She's a traitor. Does the Revolutionary War mean nothing to you?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Oh, my God.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Never forget. Never forget.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Isn't your wife from another...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, but we didn't break free from Russia. And by the way...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: We still haven't. We still have not.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You're married to a Russian.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Stop it. What bugs me about this story is the assumption that because someone cares, we all must care. I don't care. I don't care. Royalty news is artificial nonsense. It's the Monday reflex to cover a story the way we cover Groundhog Day. Except this is more tedious than Groundhog Day. By the way, there are other royalty stories we could cover. What about the Saudi new king? There's royalty. What about the prince...

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I mentioned him in the "B" block.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What about Prince Alawi (ph)? Didn't he own FOX News? He's shackled somewhere in a...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Come on! How are you are ruining my segment.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You're not getting invited to the royal wedding.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: And finally -- no, finally, royalty is a reminder to everyone that life is a crapshoot. That you do not pick your parents. That one day some guy wakes up, he's a prince, and in another area somebody is a pauper. It's unfair.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Maybe you should take Prince Harry's advice and go to counseling.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Last time we did this segment, I got in so much trouble. Just remember, when I said that we were going to interview the baby's umbilical cord. And second floor called me, because that was like the royal -- I was insulting the royal baby. No, I wasn't.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: And you're terrible.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The royal baby doesn't even watch "The Five."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: That's why Martha MacCallum will come back on. Oh, my gosh. They're hard wrapping you now, crazy one. Stay right there. "The Fastest Seven" is up next.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Welcome back. There's some more football controversies. But this time it has nothing to do with the anthem protests. First up, the Raiders clobbered the Broncos yesterday, 21-15 after a different kind of fight broke out on the field in the first quarter.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.utterance: We have a fight on the other side. Look at this. After Crabtree. Helmets being thrown. Talib grabbed it off. Referee is down and look, holding onto his ribs.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: An old, bitter rivalry renewed between Oakland's Michael Crabtree and Denver's Aqib Talib. Both players got ejected from the game. Team members from both sides got involved. And things took a while to settle down. Raiders guard Gabe Jackson also was ejected for making contact with the ref. I know you know everything about the back story to this, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, I do remember growing up when Elway was the quarterback, that Denver hated the Oakland Raiders.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: They did?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes, right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And that is all you know. Kind of like me in the last segment on the royals. Gutfeld, what did you think?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know, I always find it weird that you get ejected from a game as punishment. Because that would seem like a reward to me to go back and get out and shower early, get to the bar. And I always keep thinking, is there any -- is there any way for me to get ejected early from "The Five"?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Kimberly almost ejected you last segment.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I did. Yes, kick you out.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It would be great, to be sent out. And I'd be already home.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: And not be upset about it? I would be mortified. I would never get over it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: As long as we get paid.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That would never happen to you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Getting suspended from school was great. Did you ever get suspended from school?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Obviously no.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, never, Gutfeld.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: We got awards, OK?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The fight of the month.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You had your pay docked?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: That's what happens to them.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I did want to ask what you did to get suspended, because it's probably...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Firecrackers in a locker.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right, next. Wouldn't you like to know what set off this scene on a field in Tennessee? A Maryland high school cheerleader caught on tape grabbing the quarterback by his mask to give him a piece of her mind. Was it a quarrel? The young woman seen in the video says no. Grace Levinsky (ph) posted on Twitter, "For everybody who saw that video of me and Dylan Hopkins, we're very good friends, and it's not what it looks like." Kimberly, you've never done that to any player that you've been dating, right?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: "You're not going out with your friends after the game!"

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I mean...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: "You're coming home with me."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Obviously, I wouldn't even have to persuade in this fashion, let's be honest. But I don't think it's actually a good idea to, like, pull someone by their face mask. I'd throw a flag on that play.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's a 15-yard penalty.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: It is. It's 15 yards. So I don't know. I don't think that looks so charming or consensual.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Juan -- Juan, what do you think was happening there?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So this is interesting, because the previous segment, I see people throwing punches at people who have helmets on their head. And now she's grabbing the face mask, which as Kimberly points out. Penalty, penalty, penalty. But you know, so it turns out that they are -- have some relationship. She says they're friends. Or maybe they're even boyfriend- girlfriend. That's one way to get your man's attention. I'll tell you, he's not going to forget that one.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: No, that was highly embarrassing. I don't think they're going to be dating much longer.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: She seems mad at him.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't know. I love -- you know you have caption contests? That's pretty fun. I wish, if she's going to tweet about it, I wish she would tell us more, what she told him.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, we want the gossip.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: It probably involved another cheerleader.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, definitely.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Doesn't it always, Kimberly? Every problem in life involves another cheerleader. Anyway, I want a movie about this, about everything that led to that moment, reconstructed three ways from three different directors.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: It's called "Love, Actually."

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Each -- don't ever say that word -- those words in front of me. You know when when you say "Love, Actually," I get very angry.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: He freaks out.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I can't finish my thought now.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: The three different directors, talking about the movie, reconstructed.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's over now for me, because she said, "Love, Actually."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: His most hated...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: There isn't a thing this White House can do without the liberal media crying foul. Not even bake pie. True story. Next.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: This Thanksgiving, White House press secretary Sarah Sanders decided to do some baking. Why is that news? Well, she posted a picture of her chocolate pecan pie online, and it looked picture-perfect. So almost immediately, critics questioned its authenticity. Urban Radio Networks reporter April Ryan was among the skeptics. She tweeted, quote, "Show it to us on a table."

utterances.speaker: Sanders fired back at the piegate conspiracy
utterances.utterance: "Don't worry, April Ryan, because I'm nice, I'll bake one for you next week. #RealPie #FakeNews." Oh, my gosh.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think they were joking. I mean, I can't imagine -- First of all, it's ridiculous for anyone to suggest that Sarah Huckabee Sanders wouldn't know how to bake, because...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She's a woman?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Sexist!

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: No. I'm just...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I guess all women know how to make pies, Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I'm not saying that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Maybe -- you know what I'm going to say? I'm with April on this. This pie looks too perfect. It's like when Bill Hemmer posts Instagram pictures of his quads and his pecs. And I'm going, "That's not you, Bill." I want to see the real thing. I'm just surprised a liberal, typical liberal just doesn't believe anybody could make their own pie.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: OK, that's not what I'm saying. I think that people got carried away. I think -- I think April was probably joking.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Well, let's hope. I don't know. I mean, if you take it to a serious level, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, I'm serious about this.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: And if you want -- I am with Dana. But if you want to be serious, this has to do with, you could say, oh, this has to do with we were talking about the TIME magazine thing or the biggest inauguration ever. Is this about the credibility? That April Ryan is saying she doesn't believe anything that comes out of the mouth of this administration.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, let's get to the crust of the matter. I mean the crux of the matter, Juan. Piegate shows how the relationship between the press and White House has crumbled. Trust is a very important ingredient. And without it, it's a recipe for disaster. And the public just doesn't have the appetite for these types of petty skirmishes. I'm glad Sanders took the pie road, I mean the high road. And she handled it tastefully.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: This was excellent. That was excellent.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That was for Gutfeld.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Peter would do something like that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But better.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Better, yes. I left that part out. She gave you a little bit of mincemeat pie there.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, she did.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: So Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Is it pe-cahn or pe-can?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Pe-can. Kimberly, let me ask you...

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: He's an authority on this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Sounds like a drug advertised at FOX News.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I understand -- I understand where April Ryan says show us people eating. But why "Show it to me on the table?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Show me the pie. I don't know, because she wants to see it in person. Like proof, like up close and personal. Like serve it up to me, show it to me. I don't know. Come on, like "covfefe." People are obsessing about the pe-cahn pie thing, or pe-can -- I don't know, potato, po-tah-toe. But no, I think that Sarah Sanders baked the pie.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So do we.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: So I don't understand why everyone is so up in arms about it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: And here's the thing...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I would've just gone to a bakery and bought it, but you know.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Yes, I've got to tell you, but people are upset because she's from Arkansas. And a southern woman should not be questioned, I'm told, on her cooking. Anyway, "One More Thing" up next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Pe-can.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Time for "One More Thing" -- Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So if you saw the Thanksgiving show, you might have seen that Greg said that the best gift he ever got was the encyclopedia, a set of encyclopedias.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: So guess what? You can still get them.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Really?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It's not just all online. The World Book Encyclopedia is celebrating its 100th year. It used to employ an international sales force of 40,000 people. Today there's about 100, one of which is a guy named Kerry Kirren (ph) in Ontario. And he calls himself the lonely salesman. You can still get -- you can get digital subscriptions, but teachers and librarians have been telling parents that it's good for children to have the actual book. And this year, the world encyclopedia 2017 edition is only $899. It's usually $1,099. What a deal.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's great, but I didn't say Encyclopedia Britannica. I said the People's Almanac. Whoever sent you that information is a liar and should be fired -- Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: All right. Well, I had a fantastic time with my friend Kat McPhee. Dana knows her and is friends with her, as well.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm friends with her.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: No, you're not, Greg. She performed at the Carlisle this weekend. Fabulous shows. And it was packed, totally sold out. Very exciting. And it was to celebrate her new album that you can get now called "I Fall in Love Too Easily." And it's available everywhere. That's us after, having fun and went out for a couple burgers. She was accompanied by some acclaimed musicians during the performances. Frederic Yanni (ph) on harmonica and Chris Bhodi (ph) on trumpet and special guest David Foster. Take a listen.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Very nice.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Absolutely beautiful. You remember her as an alum from "American Idol." She's a big fan of the show. She should come watch sometime. And she's on the show "Scorpio" now.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. Time for...

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I hate these pimples!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: All right. So I'm over 50, which means I can see the end. You know, before 50, your 40s. You're going up a hill. You have fun. You party and doing all these awful things. And then all of a sudden, you're at the top of the hill. You can see the end. You know it's coming. Because there's less time ahead of you than there is behind, and it speeds up. And it's really bad. There's no upside to that downside. So why do I have a zit? Zits are not for old people. I have a giant zit on my neck. If I'm going to be dying of old age, and I'm getting wrinkles, there has to be a trade. Nobody over 50 should be getting zits. I don't know why I'm getting pimples.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Maybe that means you're going to live to 110.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, it's just...

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: It's because you're so juvenile. That's why.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I can't have wrinkles and zits at the same time. It doesn't make sense. I don't want to be in a coffin with Clearisil.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You need some Proactiv.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I can't relate to that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Of course, Juan. Because you're beautiful.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Thank you. Thanksgiving kicked off the holiday season. Of course, that's family time for everybody. Here are a few pictures of how my family spent this past holiday weekend. First of all, well, that's my grandson out chopping a Christmas tree. That's my brother, Roger, you know, cutting the turkey. And there, we have two couples who are getting married next June and July. That's Rafi and Morgan. And Nick and Marissa. Marissa is my niece. And here are the -- here's Reagan and Patrick with the kids, out Christmas tree chopping out in Maryland. I think Maryland. That's -- they're getting directions there.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's a riveting photo right there.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: There you go.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's pretty cute.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: We -- then we went to the mall so the grandkids could get pictures with Santa. And there they are on Santa's lap out at Pentagon City. And then the whole group got in. That's the whole family. Everybody showed up this year for the 2017 Christmas picture.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's it? No more pictures?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Your family is, like, so perfect.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I know.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: All right. The Philadelphia Eagles still rolling this year, 10-1 now on the season. And they just crushed the Chicago Bears. Alshon Jeffery caught a nice touchdown pass from Carson Wentz. Had a great little celebration in the end zone afterwards. Check this out. There's the ball, and there's the strike. And down they go. Getting a little creative there. And I'll see you guys at the Super Bowl. Sorry, Juan.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You like these planned end zone events that all the teams are having.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I'm fully supportive. Just having a little fun.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I like it. It's pretty -- they're pretty creative. You think the team did, like, the Thanksgiving dinner?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, they all passed around the stuffing.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I think you might have an ingrown hair, actually.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's a pimple.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Either way, it's starting to talk to me.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Let's call Dr. Siegel.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: Maybe Kimberly would squeeze it for you.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Ew!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Let's go. DVR and don't miss an episode of "The Five."

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: So disgusting.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I waited. Bret -- Bret, sorry about that.

utterances.speaker: BAIER
utterances.utterance: Seriously?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.utterance: Oh, my God!

utterances.speaker: BAIER
utterances.utterance: Ending on a pimple? OK. Thank you, Greg. Content and Programming Copyright 2017 Fox News Network, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED. Copyright 2017 CQ-Roll Call, Inc.
